subject: Re: [junit] What's going on with TestSuite?
msgSnippet: ... I see your point: we are talking about two different things... - a TestCollector recursively explores a directory and returns all files that match a given
messageBody:
> I am--the problem is the TestCollector won't even load the class if there
> is no "test" methods in the class!

I see your point: we are talking about two different things...

- a TestCollector recursively explores a directory and returns all files that match a given pattern. For example all files that have a "Test" in their names.
- a TestCase is only executed if it has at least one "test..." method (otherwise a warning is raised)

The TestCollector doesn't parse the file to see if it has a "test" method. At least no TestCollector found in the official release.

To summarize:
- your TestCase must implement at least one method beginning with "test"
- in order to use the standard TestCollector (but you can write your own) your TestCase must contain "Test" in its name

-Vladimir
